name: The English Tea Room at Brown's Hotel

reviews.text: We chose this tea room because of the high reviews it got not only by diners but also critics. In addition, what sold us was the fact that this is an eat as much as you like type of place, where they don't ration out three canapes and scone for a ridiculous price.
reviews.title: Unforgettable tea time

reviews.text: On almost all other occasions we don't care of all you can eat types of places anywhere in the world but at tea the portions can be quite tiny and terribly expensive. The option to also try not just one tea but a couple really made a difference.
reviews.title: Normal or gluten free everyone is catered for

reviews.text: The actual tea room is very nice and comfortable. Service is impeccable as is the food and teas they serve. If you have a chance to do tea in London don't miss out on this fabulous tea room. Truly everything from the general ambiance, piano music, service and food is incredible. Most nice teas in London don't come cheap but this place is soooo worth it.
reviews.title: Lovely atmosphere, great gluten free food but slow service

reviews.text: I would highly recommend Brown's for afternoon tea and also for anyone needing a gluten free diet. We took our mum for her 80th birthday, she has Coeliac disease and finds it difficult to find many places that cater for a gluten free diet. Her sandwiches looked the same as ours and she even had little cakes, as a surprise for her birthday the staff brought out a little cake on a plate with happy 80th birthday written in chocolate on the plate. We all had a lovely afternoon with more sanwiches being brought out as soon as our plates emptied, this included gluten free and tea being poured for us as we emptied our cups. There's a wide selection of tea available and juice if tea isn't your choice of drink, all in all I would recommend Brown's to anyone looking for a treat or special occasion. The staff were excellent and also Henry who I spoke to via emails to arrange the gluten free tea and surprise.
reviews.title: Expensive yes, but excellent

reviews.text: I took my 10 year old daughter and her grandparents to Browns for afternoon tea as a birthday treat. As I am vegetarian and gluten intolerant I researched widely to find the right place for afternoon tea. Brown's came highly recommended. I loved the atmosphere the music and how welcoming they were to my daughter. The table we were at was very small and so fitting the 2 cake stands necessary (1 gluten free 1 not) was quite hard. I loved the sandwiches I was given, the sweet treats and scones and it was lovely to know I wouldn't get ill. The other 3 people at my table had the same amount of food as me on my own and it wasn't made clear that they could have as much as they wanted so they initially felt a little put out. The tea had to go on a stand next to our table as the table was small and we felt unable to help ourselves to it. It was really hard to attract the attention of the waiter so we were left tealess for some time! We also did not get clean plates between sandwiches and scones which wasn't great as they became dirty. My daughter had a fabulous time at a proper English Tea and I loved my gluten free foods but the staff are inattentive.
reviews.title: A+ Service, lovely staff and atmosphere

reviews.text: We have sampled the Afternoon Teas at a number of London Hotels and some other around the Country. We often have tea if we are going to the theatre, as the timing works well and it can be very satisfying and enjoyable.
reviews.title: Just Too Expensive

reviews.text: This was the second time at Browns, having enjoyed tea there quite a few years ago. This time it was a little disappointing and really not value for money. The service was very attentive and the staff took the trouble to see that everyone, especially those who had not experienced English Afternoon Tea before, knew what they were going to have to eat and drink.
reviews.title: Very impressive!

reviews.text: There was a good selection of very fresh sandwiches and plenty of them. The dainty pastries were a little disappointing, as so often in other establishments recently. The high quality pastries having been replaced by slightly strange creations, mousses, cup cakes (ugh!) and brownies.
reviews.title: A relaxing afternoon

reviews.text: The scones were very good and fresh and the cream generous and of good quality; so too was the excellent strawberry jam. To finish there was Victoria sponge, which was spoilt by an over-powering artificial cream, or Simnel cake, which was good, with plenty of fruit. Accompanying all this was plenty of fine tea of various blends.
reviews.title: Perfect Mother's Day Treat

reviews.text: The problem was the price. Since the Olympics the London hotels seem to have decided that Afternoon Tea is a good way to make a lot of money out of tourists and they have simply made the price too high. I have given this Tea three stars because I recognize that London simply is very expensive, but on absolute value for money it could have been only two stars.
reviews.title: Excellent Experience
Nice high tea
reviews.text: I actually had a special detox menu this time, and my company had normal tea menu. Both were good, and you do not leave this tearoom hungry. Nice and calm place. We had done a lot of shopping and the staff took care of all bags and stuff while we enjoyed our tea.

reviews.title: WOW! This is what I call a proper tea
reviews.text: We went to Browns for the first time - quite an experience. The champagne was delicious; the food quite tasty and unlimited; and the service impeccable. My daughter ordered one of the reserve teas and was not disappointed. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Really lovely afternoon tea
reviews.text: What's not to like, comfortable surroundings, pleasant and knowledgeable staff and lovely food. Starting off with a range of finger sized sandwiches, refilled as often as you want, then mini scones with the best strawberry jam ever! Follow this with a selection of mini cakes ( the tiny Battenburg was my favourite) before finishing with a slice of Victoria sponge. They'd have fed us more if my stomach could have taken it. A really lovely tea

reviews.title: High Tea - and nothing else
reviews.text: Just okay, Perhaps not what we wanted - the tearoom had only High Tea, which every guest at the table had to order. And if I have to order something I do not want - why should I come here again - Useless place for us.

We visited for afternoon tea. From the minute we arrived it was lovely, we were a little early but we did not have to wait. The choices of tea were extensive and we chose a speciality tea which came with a brew timer and a glass bowl. The sandwiches and pastries were of the highest quality and, naturally, presented beautifully. Nothing was too much trouble. We would definately return.
reviews.title: Beautiful surroundings. Lovely Tea

reviews.text: I love Brown’s Hotel and its cozy, traditional tea room off Abermarle Street. I took my daughter and her friend to Brown’s this summer and fell in love with the ritual and elegance of afternoon tea and the traditional vibe of Brown’s. An important factor in the ceremony of afternoon tea (for me) is the setting, and Brown’s Hotel has it in spades.
reviews.title: Quintessential Afternoon Tea at Brown's
Brilliant
reviews.text: I am partial to the first of Brown’s two tea rooms. I love the dark wood paneling, the piano and overstuffed setees underneath the window. Both rooms are lovely, in all honesty, and we were escorted to the second room which was bright, elegant and comfortable. We were fortunate to have a corner table where I could observe the goings on in the tea room and on the street. The tables were as they should be, low and laden with crisp heavy linen, lovely tea cups and heavy silver pots. I plopped myself onto the overstuffed setee, propped myself up on the pillows and prepared myself for an afternoon of tea and cakes.

Brown’s offers a number of menu selections, including the traditional or champagne teas. I vaguely remember the waiter offering a “healthy” tea option. Seriously? I didn’t care to know, so I didn’t ask what that might entail. I’m sure you could call and ask. We ordered the more exotic teas from the tea list, while my husband ordered the Browns Afternoon Tea Blend. He is not amused by exotic choices.
reviews.title: Scrumptious

reviews.text: Our server poured the first cups of tea and delivered an elaborate 3-tiered stand laden with tiny chocolate desserts, scones still warm from the oven and a variety of crustless sandwiches. Most importantly, they brought a crock of fresh clotted cream and another crock of homemade strawberry preserves.
reviews.title: I didn't have to do a thing............
english atmosphere for a classical english tea
reviews.text: My husband started on the bottom tray of sandwiches. We started on the top tray of pastries and all met in the middle for the tiny scones and clotted cream. Dear. God. The most dangerous part of afternoon tea at Brown’s is the willingness of the staff to refill your trays as soon as they are empty. We managed to polish off 2 trays each of lovely chocolate pastries, scones and sandwiches. We had to order a refill of the clotted cream as well to ensure the proper balance of cream and jam on every scone.
